column4: Hello everyone. What are the repository lines I need to place in my sources.list file to make Apt-get read from the internet?
It only had my deb cdrom line there.
I'm not on standard Ubuntu
On Ubuntu-Server
if you're server only, let me know
a sec
you should have an /etc/apt/sources.list then. uncomment lines similar to the one dns53 just gave you
except for backports and proposed
http://paste.ubuntu.com/20093/ , replace my oakland with archive.ubuntu.com , or another mirror (unless you're in california)
just save that file then :) Where in CA
put it on a thumbdrive, and  echo <thatfile> >> /etc/apt/sources.list
wget  http://aphroneo.net/sources.list
cd is built into just about all shells, that's very odd
people ask questions, sometime stupid sounding ones, so everyone is on the same page. Can the attitude

run   sudo dpkg-reconfigure -pcritical xserver-xorg , that will cause X to choose the best open source driver available for whatever card it finds. Then you can choose a proprietary one later if you like

run   sudo dpkg-reconfigure -pcritical xserver-xorg , that will cause X to choose the best open source driver available for whatever card it finds. Then you can choose a proprietary one later if you like
I am installing my old GeForce, because apparently my Intel card keeps messing up. Games keep locking up the entire computer (which is a video driver error from what I gathered at #winehq)
yeah, just run that command now, then stick in the card. Make sure you turn off the onboard in bios
Can you give me the command again?
sudo dpkg-reconfigure -pcritical xserver-xorg
xserver-xorg postinst warning: overwriting possibly-customised configuration
that's fine
like it says, it's saving the old one in case you want it later
